00017 # SKEL: Welcome to the ContentGenerator skeleton!
00018 # 
00019 # This module is designed to help you in creating subclasses of
00020 # WeBWorK::ContentGenerator. Follow the instructions marked "SKEL" below to
00021 # create your very own module.
00022 # 
00023 # When you've finished, I recommend you do some cleanup. These modules are much
00024 # easier to maintain if they doesn't contain "vestigal" garbage code. Remove the
00025 # "SKEL" comments and anything else that that you're not using in your module.
00026 
00027 # SKEL: Declare the name and superclass of your module here:
00028 package WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Skeleton;
00029 use base qw(WeBWorK::ContentGenerator);
00030 
00031 # SKEL: change the name of the module below and provide a short description. Add
00032 # additional POD documentation as you see fit.
00033 
00034 =head1 NAME
00035 
00036 WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Skeleton - Template for creating subclasses of
00037 WeBWorK::ContentGenerator.
00038 
00039 =cut
00040 
00041 use strict;
00042 use warnings;
00043 
00044 # SKEL: Add "use" lines for libraries you will be using here. Note that you only
00045 # need to add a "use" line here if you will be instantiating now objects or
00046 # calling free functions. If you have an existing instance (like $self->r) you
00047 # can use it without a corresponding "use" line. Sample lines are given below:
00048 # 
00049 # You'll probably want to generate HTML code:
00050 #use CGI qw(-nosticky );
00051 # 
00052 # You might need some utility functions:
00053 #use WeBWorK::Utils qw(function1 function2);
00054 
00055 # SKEL: If you need to do any processing before the HTTP header is sent, do it
00056 # in this method:
00057 # 
00058 #sub pre_header_initialize {
00059 #   my ($self) = @_;
00060 #   
00061 #   # Do your processing here! Don't print or return anything -- store data in
00062 #   # the self hash for later retrieveal.
00063 #}
00064 
00065 # SKEL: To emit your own HTTP header, uncomment this:
00066 # 
00067 #sub header {
00068 #   my ($self) = @_;
00069 #   
00070 #   # Generate your HTTP header here.
00071 #   
00072 #   # If you return something, it will be used as the HTTP status code for this
00073 #   # request. The Apache::Constants module might be useful for gerating status
00074 #   # codes. If you don't return anything, the status code "OK" will be used.
00075 #   return "";
00076 #}
00077 
00078 # SKEL: If you need to do any processing after the HTTP header is sent, but before
00079 # any template processing occurs, or you need to calculate values that will be
00080 # used in multiple methods, do it in this method:
00081 # 
00082 #sub initialize {
00083 #   my ($self) = @_;
00084 #   
00085 #   # Do your processing here! Don't print or return anything -- store data in
00086 #   # the self hash for later retrieveal.
00087 #}
00088 
00089 # SKEL: If you need to add tags to the document <HEAD>, uncomment this method:
00090 # 
00091 #sub head {
00092 #   my ($self) = @_;
00093 #   
00094 #   # You can print head tags here, like <META>, <SCRIPT>, etc.
00095 #   
00096 #   return "";
00097 #}
00098 
00099 # SKEL: To fill in the "info" box (to the right of the main body), use this
00100 # method:
00101 # 
00102 #sub info {
00103 #   my ($self) = @_;
00104 #   
00105 #   # Print HTML here.
00106 #   
00107 #   return "";
00108 #}
00109 
00110 # SKEL: To provide navigation links, use this method:
00111 # 
00112 #sub nav {
00113 #   my ($self, $args) = @_;
00114 #   
00115 #   # See the documentation of path() and pathMacro() in
00116 #   # WeBWorK::ContentGenerator for more information.
00117 #   
00118 #   return "";
00119 #}
00120 
00121 # SKEL: For a little box for display options, etc., use this method:
00122 # 
00123 #sub options {
00124 #   my ($self) = @_;
00125 #   
00126 #   # Print HTML here.
00127 #   
00128 #   return "";
00129 #}
00130 
00131 # SKEL: For a list of sibling objects, use this method:
00132 # 
00133 #sub siblings {
00134 #   my ($self, $args) = @_;
00135 #   
00136 #   # See the documentation of siblings() and siblingsMacro() in
00137 #   # WeBWorK::ContentGenerator for more information.
00138 #   # 
00139 #   # Refer to implementations in ProblemSet and Problem.
00140 #   
00141 #   return "";
00142 #}
00143 
00144 # SKEL: Okay, here's the body. Most of your stuff will go here:
00145 # 
00146 sub body {
00147     my ($self) = @_;
00148     
00149     # SKEL: Useful things from the superclass:
00150     # 
00151     # The WeBWorK::Request object. Good for accessing request params and so on.
00152     #my $r = $self->r;
00153     # 
00154     # Do you need data from the course environment?
00155     #my $ce = $r->ce;
00156     # 
00157     # Will you be accessing the database?
00158     #my $db = $r->db;
00159     # 
00160     # Query authorization:
00161     #my $authz = $r->authz;
00162     # 
00163     # The WeBWorK::URLPath object. Necessary for getting/generating URL data:
00164     #my $urlpath = $r->urlpath;
00165     
00166     # FIXME: Add more examples of common idioms, mention WeBWorK::HTML::*
00167     # classes, refer to superclass methods.
00168     
00169     # SKEL: Print your content here!
00170     
00171     return "";  
00172 }
